easy.a: A robot that tracks a line on the ground

easy.q: What is a cobot?
easy.a: A collaborative robot designed to work with people

easy.a: Computing a safe path from point A to B

easy.q: What is a mobile robot base?
easy.a: The chassis and wheels or tracks that move a robot

easy.q: Why do robots use depth cameras?
What is object detection?
easy.a: Recognizing and locating items in images

What is SLAM?
What is a servo motor?
easy.a: A motor with position control feedback

What are robot actuators for?
What is a quadruped robot?
What is an AGV?
What is geofencing for drones?
What is a robotic lawn mower?
easy.a: A mower that cuts grass autonomously

easy.q: What is computer vision used for in robots?
easy.a: Interpreting images to understand the environment

easy.q: What do ultrasonic sensors measure?
What is an end effector?
easy.a: The tool attached to a robot arm's end

easy.q: What is waypoint navigation?
easy.a: Moving through a series of set points

easy.q: What does autonomy mean in robots?
What is a drone propeller for?
What is a proximity sensor?
easy.a: A sensor that detects nearby objects

easy.q: What is a robotic kit for students?
easy.a: A set of parts to build and program a robot

easy.q: What is a pick-and-place task?
easy.a: Picking up an item and placing it elsewhere

easy.q: What is a motion capture marker used for?
easy.a: Tracking robot or human movement for control

easy.q: What is a mobile manipulator?
easy.a: A robot with wheels and an arm

What is a battery swap for drones?
What is a GPS waypoint?
What is a joystick used for with robots?
What is calibration in robotics?
easy.a: Aligning sensors or joints for accuracy

easy.q: What is a payload on a robot?
easy.a: The weight or tool it can carry

easy.q: What is an IMU used for?
What is waypoint following in drones?
What is line of sight for drone pilots?
easy.a: Being able to see the drone directly

easy.q: What is a failsafe return-to-home?
easy.a: Automatic return when signal or battery is low

easy.q: What is a manipulator joint called?
What is a tool changer on a robot?
easy.a: A system to swap end effectors quickly

medium.q: What does inverse kinematics solve in a robot arm?
medium.a: Joint angles needed to reach a position
Computing end effector position from joint states

medium.q: What is a URDF file in ROS?
medium.a: A robot description format for links and joints

medium.q: What do PID controllers do in robotics?
medium.a: Stabilize motion using proportional, integral, derivative terms
Building a map of free and occupied space
A set of 3D points from sensors like lidar
Reducing sharp turns in a planned path

medium.q: What does a Kalman filter help with?
medium.a: Estimating state from noisy sensor data

medium.q: What is a mecanum wheel useful for?
medium.a: Enabling omnidirectional drive
Publish/subscribe channels for robot data
Recognizing previously visited places to correct the map
Letting people attend remotely with a mobile robot

medium.q: What is force sensing on a gripper?
medium.a: Measuring applied force to avoid damage
Timing and shaping motion between waypoints
Avoiding moving objects in real time
Many robots coordinating as a group

medium.q: What is a ROS bag file?
medium.a: Recorded sensor and topic data for playback

medium.q: What is a teach pendant used for?
medium.a: Programming and jogging industrial robots
Gradual position error accumulating over time
Estimating motion from camera frames

medium.q: What is a safety light curtain?
medium.a: Sensors that stop robots when a beam is broken

medium.q: What is a force-torque sensor for?
medium.a: Measuring forces at a robot wrist

medium.q: What is a vacuum gripper good for?
medium.a: Picking flat or smooth objects with suction
Controlling how stiff or compliant a robot behaves

medium.q: What is a PLC in automation?
medium.a: Programmable logic controller
Measuring distance by timing light pulses

medium.q: What is a digital twin for robots?
medium.a: A virtual model used to simulate robot systems

medium.q: What is a redundant robot arm?
medium.a: One with more joints than necessary for positioning

medium.q: What does ROS 2 add over ROS 1?
medium.a: DDS messaging, real-time improvements, and security
Delay between sensing and usable information
A network of points connected for navigation
Light detection and ranging
An arm with six degrees of freedom for positioning
A motion limit like no sideways sliding on wheels
Updating the path as conditions change

medium.q: What is a gripper fingertip design for?
medium.a: Tailoring contact for specific objects
The cell size in a map representation

medium.q: What is an industrial robot safety cage for?
medium.a: Physically separating humans from robot motion
Autonomous mobile robots moving goods
Stacking boxes or bags onto pallets with robots
Limiting power and force to reduce injury risk

medium.q: What is a SLAM back end?
medium.a: Optimization that refines the map and trajectory

hard.q: What algorithm underpins probabilistic roadmap planning?
hard.a: Sampling random nodes and connecting feasible edges

hard.q: What does RRT stand for?
hard.a: Rapidly-exploring Random Tree

hard.q: What is RRT*'s advantage over RRT?
hard.a: It rewires for asymptotically optimal paths

hard.q: What is the Jacobian used for in robotics?
hard.a: Relating joint velocities to end-effector velocities

hard.q: What is operational space control?
hard.a: Controlling motion in task space rather than joint space

hard.q: What is the difference between serial and parallel manipulators?
hard.a: Serial links connect in a chain; parallel use multiple arms to one platform

hard.q: What does PID gain tuning affect?
hard.a: Stability, overshoot, and response speed

hard.q: What is dynamic stability in legged robots?
hard.a: Maintaining balance while moving with changing support polygons

hard.q: What is MPC in robotics?
hard.a: Model predictive control for constrained optimization

hard.q: What is a Kalman filter assumption about noise?
hard.a: Gaussian noise with known covariance

hard.q: What is factor graph optimization used for in SLAM?
hard.a: Representing constraints to solve for poses and landmarks

hard.q: What is ICP alignment?
hard.a: Iterative closest point aligning point clouds

hard.q: What is a voxel map used for?
hard.a: 3D occupancy representation

hard.q: What is sensor fusion?
hard.a: Combining multiple sensors to improve estimates

hard.q: What is time synchronization in sensor suites?
hard.a: Aligning timestamps so data fuses correctly

hard.q: What is backdrivability?
hard.a: Ability to move a joint by external force

hard.q: What is impedance vs admittance control difference?
hard.a: Impedance sets force response; admittance sets motion response to force

hard.q: What is proprioception in robots?
hard.a: Sensing internal state like joint positions and torques

hard.q: What is tactile sensing?
hard.a: Measuring contact forces or textures at end effectors

hard.q: What is a UR5 robot an example of?
hard.a: A 6-axis collaborative arm

hard.q: What is EtherCAT used for in robots?
hard.a: Real-time industrial fieldbus communication

hard.q: What are ROS message types defined in?
hard.a: .msg files specifying fields

hard.q: What is ROS action server used for?
hard.a: Handling long-running goals with feedback

hard.q: What is a SLAM front end responsible for?
hard.a: Feature extraction and data association

hard.q: What is a Kalman filter innovation term?
hard.a: The difference between predicted and measured values

hard.q: What is singularity in manipulators?
hard.a: A configuration where motion becomes limited or unstable

hard.q: What is redundancy resolution?
hard.a: Choosing joint motions when multiple solutions exist

hard.q: What is a Jacobian transpose control method?
hard.a: Using the transpose to map desired forces to joint torques

hard.q: What is a wrench in robotics?
hard.a: Combined forces and torques vector

hard.q: What is minimum jerk trajectory planning?
hard.a: Creating smooth motion minimizing jerk

hard.q: What is hybrid force/motion control?
hard.a: Controlling force along some axes and position along others

hard.q: What is a compliant joint?
hard.a: One that allows some give or elasticity

hard.q: What is teleoperation latency risk?
hard.a: Delay causing control overshoot or instability

hard.q: What is actuator saturation?
hard.a: When a motor hits its torque or speed limits

hard.q: What is kinematic singularity avoidance?
hard.a: Planning motions to stay away from problematic poses

hard.q: What is an occupancy voxel inflation radius?
hard.a: Margin added around obstacles for safety

hard.q: What is ROS tf used for?
hard.a: Managing coordinate frame transforms

hard.q: What is a URDF transmission element?
hard.a: Defines how actuators drive joints

hard.q: What is the Denavit-Hartenberg convention?
hard.a: A standard way to describe robot link geometry

hard.q: What is torque control on a motor?
hard.a: Commanding torque rather than speed or position

hard.q: What is a safety PLC used for?
hard.a: Certified control for emergency stops and safety logic

hard.q: What is a robot's workspace?
hard.a: The volume the end effector can reach

hard.q: What is SLAM graph sparsification?
hard.a: Reducing factors to speed up optimization

hard.q: What is visual servoing?
hard.a: Using camera feedback to control motion

hard.q: What is the purpose of a teach mode speed limit?
hard.a: Slow movement when humans program robots

hard.q: What is RTK GPS used for?
hard.a: Centimeter-level positioning with corrections

hard.q: What is a compliant grasp?
hard.a: Allowing slight motion to conform to object shape

hard.q: What is a proprioceptive sensor example?
hard.a: Joint encoders or torque sensors
